result.execSummary:
The defendant Denis Reyes Santos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 45 days credit.  TIME SERVED

Standard Court Costs and DNA Surcharge waived by the court. PAID IN FULL

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:40 a.m.
Intern Julian Marrufo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Denis Reyes Santos.
Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody. 
Interpreter, Sarah St. John sworn to interpret.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
45-DAYS JAIL
45-DAYS CREDIT TIME
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

COSTS: $243.00 (WAIVED BY THE COURT)
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (WAIVED BY THE COURT)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered;  filed by Atty. Pablo Galaviz

9:47 AM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised that parties discussed scheduling off the record to set a Jury Trial in 22CF12117 and 22CM1271 will tag along.  Clerk swears in interpreter Sally Nichols, who appeared by Zoom.  Defense counsel advised that defendant did not understand the interpretation.  Discussion made regarding interpreter and languages spoken.  Atty. Galaviz gave clarification to the Court and defendant regarding bail motion.

addressed to: Denis Reyes Santos for hearing on 9-23-2022 at 9:30 a.m. 
Return to Sender, Insufficient Address, Unable to Forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Denis Reyes Santos
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: No Permanent Address, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Frame Park listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:18 PM Defendant Denis Reyes Santos in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  INTERPRETER NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
